title: 2018–19 North Dakota Fighting Hawks men's basketball team
text:
The 2018–19 North Dakota Fighting Hawks men's basketball team represented the <a href="University%20of%20North%20Dakota">University of North Dakota</a> during the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20men%27s%20basketball%20season">2018–19 NCAA Division I men's basketball season</a>. The Fighting Hawks, led by 13th-year head coach <a href="Brian%20Jones%20%28basketball%2C%20born%201971%29">Brian Jones</a>, played their home games at the <a href="Betty%20Engelstad%20Sioux%20Center">Betty Engelstad Sioux Center</a> in <a href="Grand%20Forks%2C%20North%20Dakota">Grand Forks, North Dakota</a> as first-year members of the <a href="Summit%20League">Summit League</a>. They finished the season 12–18 overall, 6–10 in Summit League play, to finish in 7th place. In the <a href="2019%20Summit%20League%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20Tournament">Summit League Tournament</a>, they were defeated by <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Omaha%20Mavericks%20men%27s%20basketball%20team">Omaha</a> in the quarterfinals.
On May 1, 2019, it was announced that head coach Brian Jones was stepping down, in order to take the associate head coaching position at <a href="Illinois%20State%20Redbirds%20men%27s%20basketball">Illinois State</a>. On May 30, head coach of DII <a href="Northern%20State%20Wolves%23Men%27s%20basketball">Northern State</a>, <a href="Paul%20Sather">Paul Sather</a>, was announced as Jones' replacement.
Previous season.
The <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20North%20Dakota%20Fighting%20Hawks%20men%27s%20basketball%20team">Fighting Hawks</a> finished the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20men%27s%20basketball%20season">2017–18 season</a> 12–20, 6–12 in <a href="Big%20Sky%20Conference">Big Sky</a> play to finish in a tie for eighth place. They defeated <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Montana%20State%20Bobcats%20men%27s%20basketball%20team">Montana State</a> in the first round of the <a href="2018%20Big%20Sky%20Conference%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20Tournament">Big Sky Tournament</a> before losing in the quarterfinals to <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Montana%20Grizzlies%20basketball%20team">Montana</a>.
This season was the last for North Dakota as a full Big Sky member. On July 1, 2018, the school joined the Summit League in all sports except for <a href="North%20Dakota%20Fighting%20Hawks%20football">football</a>. The football team is playing the 2018 and 2019 seasons as an <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20FCS%20independent%20schools">FCS independent</a>, but will play a full Big Sky schedule in both seasons, after which it will join the <a href="Missouri%20Valley%20Football%20Conference">Missouri Valley Football Conference</a>.
